name: Unofficial Condor Crick
description:
Introduction

This is a quick and easy rappel that can be done as a training site on a popular hiking trail that leads to multiple other canyons and peaks. Be courteous to bicycles and hikers. If you will be here for an extended time on a weekend, set up two raps: a short 10-20 footer to the plateau below, and a longer 60-70 footer for the loitering, then clear the trail for traffic.

Approach

Park at the unofficial condor peak trail lot just a few hundred yards beyond Vogel Flat Road. A short 0.2 mile hike to the first trickle creek, which is very obvious. You can still see the road from the point where you first hear the water. The opposite dry gully can also be rappelled to the same completion point.

Descent

Multiple trees and bushes are available to drop from different locations. There is some healthy poison oak, as with most Big T canyons.

Exit

Just walk back to the road along the water and exit canyon right by the culvert.

Red tape

No

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

Background

First descent by Jane Fontana and Mark Fitzsimmons on April 17, 2023.
